stem: An 18-year-old with Sickle Cell Disease reports 10/10 skeletal pain and is tachypneic. The client has a history of a recent upper respiratory infection. Complete the clinical bowtie.

actions.text: Apply cold compresses to painful joints

rationale.correct: Crisis is caused by sickling due to hypoxia/dehydration (c1) and subsequent occlusion (c2). Hydration (a1) and pain control (a2) are the priorities. Monitoring Pain (p1) and SpO2 (p2) tracks resolution.
rationale.incorrect: Cold (a3) causes vasoconstriction and WORSENS sickling; use warmth. Restricting fluids (a4) is dangerous.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: Remember: Cold = Vasoconstriction = More Sickling. Always USE HEAT for sickle cell pain.
